attributes.action: Let GCSE English exams have copies of the text.
attributes.additional_details: A-Level have a open book exams. They study less text than GCSE students and do less subjects. If GCSEs are becoming harder why are A-levels becoming easier? This generation already have enough stress on them. They won't be able to remember formulas, equations, case studies and now different texts.
attributes.background: GCSE Students have to remember poems, parts of books... Kids study other subjects and have to remember other things. How are they expected to remember so much?
